channel.title: India News, Latest News in India, Live News India, India Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: Get the latest breaking news from India on politics and current affairs.

image.title: India News, Latest News in India, Live News India, India Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: More TDP, Congress leaders set to join TRS, claims Rao
item.description: Close on the heels of a TDP MLA announcing his decision to join TRS, the TRS president K Chandrasekhar Rao today said many others from TDP and Congress would join his party soon.

item.title: MP minister justifies number of rapes to total population
item.description: At a time when the whole nation is outraged by the alleged rape of a 5-year-old girl child in New Delhi, a Madhya Pradesh minister went on record claiming the number of rapes as still less when compared to the total population.

item.title: Harsimrat Badal disapproves clean chit given to PM, FM in 2G spectrum
item.description: Bathinda MP Harsimrat Kaur Badal came down heavily on the CBI and accused the agency of giving clean chit to the PM and finance minister in the 2G spectrum allocation scam without even examining or investigating the whole case on merit.

item.title: Roads are 'USP' of my government: Nitish
item.description: Chief minister Nitish Kumar today described roads as the USP of his government and expressed confidence that his government would significantly reduce travel times from all districts headquarters to state capital.

item.title: CPM rejects allegations on chit funds, demands probe
item.description: Former West Bengal finance minister Asim Dasgupta today urged the Centre to intervene in the chit funds scandal and, if necessary, ask the CBI to investigate the matter, rubbishing claim that such companies had mushroomed during the Left Front rule.

item.title: Not a single polio case in UP in last 3 years: Akhilesh
item.description: Uttar Pradesh has become polio-free as not a single case of the disease has been reported in the state in the past three years, chief minister Akhilesh Yadav said today.

item.title: Hamid Ansari proposes automatic suspension of disorderly members in Rajya Sabha
item.description: In a bid to ensure there is no repeat of chaos of the first part of the Budget session, a distressed Rajya Sabha chairman Hamid Ansari on mooted automatic suspension of disorderly members.

item.title: Arun Jaitley's wife visits Khalsa College in Amritsar
item.description: Sangeeta Jaitley, wife of Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha, Arun Jaitley, visited historic Khalsa College and was overwhelmed by the grandeur architectural style of the building.

item.title: Rains bring down mercury in Himachal
item.description: Mercury plummeted by 4 to 8 notches in various parts of Himachal Pradesh as the region received widespread rains.

item.title: Child rape: Manmohan calls for collective efforts to end 'depravity'
item.description: As protests against the brutal rape of the child intensified, Manmohan Singh today said collective efforts were needed to root out such "depravity" from society.

item.title: Woman's dignity must be protected both at home and office: HC
item.description: Stating that modesty, honour, dignity and reputation of a woman has to be protected at all places including her home and office, the Bombay High Court has upheld the conviction of an employee of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation for molesting a colleague at work.

item.title: Swami Kriyananda passes away in Italy
item.description: Swami Kriyananda, among the last of direct disciples of the iconic Paramhansa Yogananda, passed away Sunday in Italy, his organization Ananda Sangha announced.

item.title: Clamour grows for death to child rapists
item.description: Expressing anguish over the brutal rape of 5-year-old in Delhi, CPM leader Sitaram Yechury today backed Sushma Swaraj’s demand for giving death penalty to child rapists.

item.title: Clamour grows for death to child rapists as protests continue
item.description: "We are willing to discuss and consider this because what happened in this Delhi rape case is gruesome," CPM leader Sitaram Yechury said today.

item.title: Direct cash transfer to curb wastages, leakages: PM
item.description: Centre's ambitious direct cash transfer scheme will help in better targeting of subsidies and reducing delay in delivery of benefits besides curbing wastages and leakages, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh said on Sunday.

item.title: Station house officer suspended for using foul language against UP chief minister, Mulayam
item.description: A police official was suspended after being caught on camera allegedly using foul language against Uttar Pradesh chief minister Akhilesh Yadav and Samajwadi Party chief Mulayam Singh, police said on Sunday.

item.title: Sikkim gets PM's award for excellence in public administration
item.description: Sikkim was on Sunday given Prime Minister's award for excellence in public administration for extraordinary and innovate work done for rural development.

item.title: NIA combs Bihar districts for suspected terrorist
item.description: The NIA has searched four districts of Bihar for Tahseen Akhtar, allegedly a member of the Indian Mujahideen involved in terrorist strikes in the country, police said on Sunday.

item.title: Think out of box to solve problems, PM tells bureaucrats
item.description: Prime Minister Manmohan Singh on Sunday asked civil servants to "think out of the box" to solve problems and urged them to use technology to ensure government benefits reach everyone.

item.title: Gujarat government's failure to protect people during 2002 riots figures in US report
item.description: The chapter on India in the report runs into 60 pages, and cites abuses by police and security forces as the most significant human rights problems in 2012.

item.title: Delhi rape case: BJP women activists protest outside Sonia's residence
item.description: Scores of BJP women activists were detained on Sunday when they staged a protest outside Congress president Sonia Gandhi's residence against the rape of a five-year-old girl here.

item.title: Minor's rape case: Delhi Police to produce accused in court tomorrow
item.description: The 22-year-old man, arrested for allegedly raping a five-year old girl, will not be produced before court on Sunday as police have time till Monday to do so.

item.title: People look at Narendra Modi as a strong leader: Uma Bharti
item.description: Amid growing clamour to declare Gujarat chief minister Narendra Modi as the prime ministerial candidate of BJP, party vice-president Uma Bharti on Sunday said that people look at him as a strong leader, as they want someone who can tackle issues like terrorism, naxalism.

item.title: Child rape: Victim stable, responding to treatment; protests continue
item.description: People are out on the streets of national capital to protest the barbaric rape of a five-year-old girl, who is undergoing treatment at AIIMS.

item.title: Rajnath Singh in no hurry to declare BJP's PM choice
item.description: Allies JD (U) and Shiv Sena may be piling pressure on BJP to declare its prime ministerial candidate to checkmate Narendra Modi's nomination but the saffron party president Rajnath Singh is in no great hurry to oblige.
